Yes organic food is nice and good foodfor human consumption...while veggies,rice,corn or any high value crops  grown, these are free from pesticides, commercial fertilizers, kasi pwede yong tanim ay lagyan ng organic fertilizer at organic pesticides din by the use of plant leaves like kawkawati or the ornamental plant marigold pantaboy ng insecto yan... At kung fertilizer gawa ng compose pile sa mga cut grasses or leaves ng fruit trees nannahulog sa lupa ipunin at idecompose haluan ng iput ng manok or pinaghugasa ng isda .. pagnadecompose na di  ilagay sa bawat puno ng veggies na itinanim kaya wala na siya natikman na commercial fertilizer or pesticide... nU_RkeA88DY.title: How Much Fruit Is Too Much Fruit?
top_comments: This channel has probably saved more lives than any other institution on this planet.

Does the threshold for toxicity of fructose apply to fruit or just to added industrial sugars such as sucrose and high fructose corn syrup?

Watch below or click the link to watch on NutritionFacts.org: http://nutritionfacts.org/video/how-much-fruit-is-too-much

We all knew fruits and veggies are great for us. I don't get why so many people started second guessing that after finding adverse side effects from refined foods. Whole foods and refined foods are completely different, and just because they have similar or the same nutrient content doesn't make them the same.

ZMz7UVC7xBs.title: Anne’s Story: From student to planet hunter
top_comments:
When I was a young child, I was riding through the low population areas in New Mexico. I starred out the car window, enjoying the infinite universe. And, I was humbled and amazed at the beauty. Some of my life’s best memories are watching the night sky.

Good luck to this amazing young lady. May she go on to find many planets and live a truly happy life. Life is not always fair, but she seems like someone that genuinely deserves that outcome.
Love this great job👍....I just had to edit and add that this story, your story brought joyful/hopeful tears.  😊

i2_PADr0jAA.title: The Connection Between Organized Crime and...Sand?
top_comments: "In Italy, sand supplies are heavily influenced by organized crime."  This was actually the least surprising thing I learned in this video.

Hank Green: We're running out of sand

Anakin Skywalker: Finally

As a geologist who works with a sedimentary basin that is mostly made of sand, you also have a big problem: the disregard a lot of miners have for fossils. Thanks to the high demand for sand, a lot of illegal mines or even legal mines but with very little inspection from governments, a lot of historical data is being crushed away by heavy machinery. It's really sad to see and it's very common.
